page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES IN GRID
page.content: The area covered by the grid is mainly rural in character,bordering the coastal region kknown as the Traeth Mawr(Main Shore) crossed by the River Glaslyn.The three main villages are { {MINFFORDD,PENRHYNDEUDRAETH}and{CILFOR, the largest being {Penrhyndeudraeth} ,which means,"the peninsula between two shores."Many people in the area are employed by the I.C.I. Co. at the Cooke's Chemical Works. Others are employed by the Ffestiniog Narrow Gauge Railway Co. & many are employed in other aspects of the tourist industry. Visitors to the area enjoy hillwalking, climbing, water sports in the surrounding lakes and sea, as well as visiting places of historical interest in the surrounding district of Snowdonia. The Snowdonia National Park office is in Penrhyndeudraeth, although the village is outside.
